text: The Very Rev Garfield Hodder Williams (21 November 1881 – 8 August 1960) was an eminentLiddell Hart 2U General Correspondence, U, 1928-1969 Anglican Priest in the second quarter of the 20th century.National Archives Born into an eminent publishing family in Bromley on 21 November 1881, he was educated at the City of London School and Barts. Eschewing a medical career he undertook missionary work at home and abroad before being ordained in 1914.Who was Who 1897-1990 London, A & C Black, 1991 After this he was Principal of St Andrew's College, Gorakhpur. He was appointed an Officer of the Order of the British Empire in the 1919 New Year Honours for his services as editor of the War Journal while living in the United Provinces during the First World War. He returned to England following the war and was an Assistant Master at Rugby School. He was Secretary of the Missionary Council of the National Church Assembly from 1924 to 1929 when he was appointed Dean of Llandaff.Crockford's Clerical Directory1940-41 Oxford, OUP,1941 Two years later he became Dean of Manchester.The Deanery Of Manchester Dean Of Llandaff Appointed The Times Thursday, May 21, 1931; pg. 14; Issue 45828; col D He died on 8 August 1960.Obituary Dr. Garfield Williams Former Dean Of Manchester The Times Wednesday, Aug 10, 1960; pg. 11; Issue 54846; col A ==Notes== Category:1881 births Category:1960 deaths Category:People from Bromley Category:People educated at the City of London School Category:Alumni of the Medical College of St Bartholomew's Hospital Category:Anglican deans Category:Deans of Llandaff Category:Deans of Manchester Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire
title: Garfield Williams
